Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; exterior glazed streaky black with parts of three rays in added white above three white bands; edge and underside of foot reserved.
Curator's comments: Decorated chalice feet are not common. For other decorated Chalice Style feet, see Lemos nos. 1200 and 1201 from Gordion. See also British Museum 1924,1201.561, UCL 746 and Cambridge Fitzwilliam GR.54.1894.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0886) (phase 2)
